reviews.review_msg: Laurent's lecture may be heavy but his exams are also based on that. His slides are informative, which is helpful during exam periods. He is also caring and open to having a deeper discussion on the topic if you show up during office hours and express your interests.

Laurent is very passionate about the material he teaches but is terrible at teaching. He lectures as if everyone in the class has the same passion and level of comprehension of the material as he does. He does very little to structure his course in a way where you understand the concepts; instead, he only promotes memorization.

He was a super nice guy & was very clearly knowledgeable on the subject! However, his lectures were often scattered, and he tends to go off on tangents that aren't really applicable to the course. You can skip the lectures and just make sure to do the readings, as they have all the information needed for exams. Exams and papers were graded fairly!

The amount you have to read for this course is crazy. I feel bad for the prof because he's honestly quite old so I don't blame him, but he just reads off slides for every lecture. Lectures are extremely hard to sit through because his teaching style and because the content is really boring
very friendly and approachable. But the lectures are just him reading off the slides which makes it difficult to engage. Get ready to do a lot of reading
Nice guy, a fair marker if you put in the work.

A super friendly and knowledgeable guy but he is not good at teaching or creating a curriculum. Even for a theory-based course, he assigned a huge amount of reading (at least 3 readings averaging at about 70 pages) every week. His lectures are also often rambling and longer than necessary. He has not adjusted well to the online format.

He is obviously a very intelligent and nice man. But he is just not a good teacher. Pace is bad, explanation is bad, slides are not clear. Maybe he is better at teaching courses that are more verbal and less mathematical. but definitely avoid him for 314.
He is super nice!

Gives 100's of pages of reading a week starting from the 18th century. Try to at least read some of it, but all? Impossible with multiple classes. Also, long assignments on complex material. He at least he tried to get excited.  Going into the final exam. Expected to have read all material. Good luck to me.. brain dead.. stopped caring...

He is an intelligent, happy, kind, fair, and enthusiastic professor. I appreciated the fact that as a political science professor he wasn't pushing a left-wing agenda on the class, and was actually rather fair to all ideas. However he does have a tendency to ramble and the lectures can begin to feel very long. Overall, I'd recommend him.

I learned a lot in this class, it was an interesting class, just a little hard. He expects a lot from students.  If I got a very good mark is because I worked hard, that's all we have to do in his class.

Very Knowledgeable, for his age he makes an effort to use technology in his lectures (pp/youtube...) Spends most of his time making ivory tower econ jokes to blank disinterested faces. If you show interest and do readings you will get a A+, easiest paper marker, final exam is typical poli sci exam. Do not take unless interested in Political Economy

Not sure why there are so many negative reviews.  Laurent is super  interesting.  All his class requires is memorization of the readings and regurgitation. You can pick a handful of weeks to focus on and do pretty well.  It's one of those classes where you get as much or as little as you want out of it.  No participation mark for shy people.
the absolute worst. I'm certain nobody worked harder than myself but was not rewarded fairly. As dry and boring as any human being possible. HORRIBLE!!! avoid at all costs.
A wonderful person but do not take him if you are looking for an easy grade or  do not intend to engage with your readings in advance.  Provides a more balanced, non-biased teaching methodology.

Awesome prof.  I dare any of the haters to move to France and teach game theory and rational choice in French.  As a marker, he will reward workers, punish whiners.  This course is not required, and you'll learn more from 5 minutes of letting him speak than in a day of readings.  Give this man a digital whiteboard!

This man is utterly incomprehensible and does not belong in the department. The positive comment below forgets that political science isn't meant to be a science: it is a social science. Attempts to quantify everything simply remove any sense of critical thinking from the discourse, and Dobuzinskis definitely suffers from this.

Do not listen to these comments.  Laurent is a kind and wonderful man and a freakin' genius. Yes, the course is hard. It is one of the only truly scientific courses in the discipline. If you're in poli sci to take the LSAT, take something else. If you can't take the heat, stay out of the kitchen.

He is a good professor.  He is an objective academic that does not reward pandering.  If you make insightful inquiries, even if you disagree with him, he WILL mark you objectively. If you are really interested in the subject matter, you should try a course with him.
Horrible lecturer. Hard course if you don't study. However, he is a fair marker.

I agree he doesn't explain things well. And for this course you have to study. But, the exams are graded objectively, not subjectively due to the subject matter. Also he comes across as a nice guy, Im not sure if this has changed but he's nice and certainly not a hard ass. More lamb than lion.

In 3 words: Human sleeping pill.  Very hard to understand, unorganized, and typical hard ass prof from the movies.  Don't take him if you don't have to, just buy the book and read it, you will learn more than spending a few hundred bucks on this prof.  He is extremely partisan about his views and not afraid to show it.

It was really more of a propaganda session than a class. Can be confusing at times. Not a very enjoyable experience for those of us who happen to not subscribe to the "We Love Neoliberalism" newsletter, or "Gordon Campbell Monthly".

Not bad...easy midterm, bit tougher final (more questions). Easily impressed on essay, if you're decent and clear writer. Participation not heavily factored, doesn't remember anyone. If you can sit thru his dull lectures you can get a B atleast
Well... don't allow a political scientist try to teach math.  Kay?  Kay.
unclear, no grading criteria given
Very disorganized and an awkward weasel who will make you feel uncomfortable during the incredibly long hours of every class. Definitely avoid him!
i thought he was pretty interesting

Actually, he is quite knowledgeable.  However, his lectures are excruciating.  In a class of 20, only 3 showed up by the end of the semester.  Moreover, he is quite arrogant, despite admitting to libertarian influences.

do not take any course with this man if you consider yourself in any way progressively-minded. His over-the-top libertarianism and his unwillingness to consider any evidence that might over a substantive criticism of neo-liberalism were unbearable.
No Comments
I would never take a class with this prof at all times. I found he to be very arrogent and one sided in his views. Was often late for class.
A turn off
Way too awkward to talk to...
No Comments
Avoid at all costs! Incredibly boring, unprepared.
He wears nice suits.
